title: Recognize the Standard Equation
text: The equation is in the form of $${\left(x-h\right)}^2+{\left(y-k\right)}^2=r^2$$ which is the standard form of a circle with center at (h,k). In this case $$r=2$$. Therefore the equation represents the circle centered at (-5,-2) with radius 2.\n##figure1.gif##
